programme.title: Hamlet (1996)
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh leads an all-star cast in an adaptation of Shakespeare's great tragedy - the story of Hamlet.

programme.title: Dungeons & Dragons
programme.desc: In a film inspired by the role-playing game, the forces of good defend an empire from a diabolical mage.

programme.title: Men Don't Leave
programme.desc: Academy Award-winner Jessica Lange stars in this story of a family facing the loss of a husband and father.

programme.title: The Stupids
programme.desc: From director John Landis comes a family who puts the dumb back in stupid!

programme.title: Me and Orson Welles
programme.desc: New York, 1937. Richard (Zac Efron) lucks into a starring role in Orson Welles's production of Julius Caesar.

programme.title: Mr. Troop Mom
programme.desc: George Lopez stars as an overworked attorney who reconnects with his daughter at summer camp.

programme.title: The 11th Hour
programme.desc: The leading scientists of our time discuss the state of the world and what we can do to make a difference.

programme.title: The Accidental Tourist
programme.desc: The touching story of a travel writer who hates to travel and loves order - until suddenly everything changes.

programme.title: Caddyshack II
programme.desc: The snobs of Bushwood Country Club don't know who they're messing with.

programme.title: Cannonball Run II
programme.desc: A wealthy man offers a fortune to the first person able to travel from California to Connecticut by car.

programme.title: Hero at Large
programme.desc: While wearing a superhero costume, Steve thwarts a real crime and is soon hailed as a masked crime fighter.

programme.title: The Hudsucker Proxy
programme.desc: A recent business school graduate ready to work his way up becomes involved in a board of directors' scheme.
